elements.title: Spectroscopy of the fractal Hofstadter energy spectrum (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Spectroscopy of the fractal Hofstadter energy spectrum

High-resolution STM/STS visualizes the fractionalization of flat moiré bands into discrete Hofstadter subbands in moiré graphene near the predicted second magic angle, and experimentally establishes several fundamental properties of the fractal Hofstadter energy spectrum.

  • Kevin P. Nuckolls
  • Michael G. Scheer
  • Ali Yazdani
Article26 Feb 2025

elements.title: A lightweight shape-memory alloy with superior temperature-fluctuation resistance (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
A lightweight shape-memory alloy with superior temperature-fluctuation resistance

A Ti–Al-based shape-memory alloy adhering to the stringent criteria of lightness, functionality and extreme thermal fluctuation resistance is introduced, showing excellent superelasticity with a recoverable strain exceeding 7% and an ultra-wide temperature window from 4.2 K to 400 K.

  • Yuxin Song
  • Sheng Xu
  • Ryosuke Kainuma
ArticleOpen Access26 Feb 2025

elements.title: Programs, origins and immunomodulatory functions of myeloid cells in glioma (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Programs, origins and immunomodulatory functions of myeloid cells in glioma

A study of myeloid cells in gliomas, a type of brain tumour, used a factor-based computational framework to reveal four immunomodulatory gene-expression programs that are expressed across myeloid cell types, driven by microenvironmental cues and predictive of therapeutic response.

  • Tyler E. Miller
  • Chadi A. El Farran
  • Bradley E. Bernstein
ArticleOpen Access26 Feb 2025

elements.title: Macrophages recycle phagocytosed bacteria to fuel immunometabolic responses (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Macrophages recycle phagocytosed bacteria to fuel immunometabolic responses

Phagocytosed bacteria can serve as an alternative nutrient source for macrophages, influencing their metabolic and immune responses through the recycling of microbial components, with the process regulated by nutrient-sensing mechanisms and bacterial viability.

  • Juliette Lesbats
  • Aurélia Brillac
  • Johan Garaude
Article26 Feb 2025

elements.title: Evolutionary lability of a key innovation spurs rapid diversification (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Evolutionary lability of a key innovation spurs rapid diversification

A study shows that the rapid diversification of cichlids in African lakes is driven by their ability to evolve between having simple or complex teeth.

  • Nick Peoples
  • Michael D. Burns
  • Peter C. Wainwright
Article26 Feb 2025

elements.title: Integrated analysis of the complete sequence of a macaque genome (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Integrated analysis of the complete sequence of a macaque genome

A complete genome assembly of a crab-eating macaque, revealing 46% fewer segmental duplications and 3.83 times longer centromeres than those of humans, is presented, enhancing understanding of lineage-specific phenotypes, adaptation and primate evolution.

  • Shilong Zhang
  • Ning Xu
  • Yafei Mao
Article26 Feb 2025

elements.title: Brain-wide presynaptic networks of functionally distinct cortical neurons (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Brain-wide presynaptic networks of functionally distinct cortical neurons

Behavioural-state-dependent pyramidal neurons have a distinct pattern of long-range glutamatergic inputs, with a larger proportion of thalamic versus motor cortex inputs compared with non-behaviour-dependent neurons.

  • Ana R. Inácio
  • Ka Chun Lam
  • Soohyun Lee
ArticleOpen Access26 Feb 2025

elements.title: A hypothalamic circuit underlying the dynamic control of social homeostasis (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
A hypothalamic circuit underlying the dynamic control of social homeostasis

New data on brain-wide circuits centred around two interconnected hypothalamic neuron populations provide significant mechanistic insights into the emergence of social need during social isolation and the satiation of social need during social reunion.

  • Ding Liu
  • Mostafizur Rahman
  • Catherine Dulac
ArticleOpen Access26 Feb 2025

elements.title: Systems-level design principles of metabolic rewiring in an animal (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Systems-level design principles of metabolic rewiring in an animal

Systems-level Worm Perturb-Seq of metabolic genes reveals design principles of transcriptional metabolic rewiring, many of which can be explained by a compensation–repression model.

  • Xuhang Li
  • Hefei Zhang
  • Albertha J. M. Walhout
Article26 Feb 2025

elements.title: Glycocalyx dysregulation impairs blood–brain barrier in ageing and disease (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Glycocalyx dysregulation impairs blood–brain barrier in ageing and disease

Disruption of mucin-domain glycoprotein expression and function in the endothelial glycocalyx are associated with ageing and Alzheimer’s disease, leading to dysregulated blood–brain barrier function.

  • Sophia M. Shi
  • Ryan J. Suh
  • Tony Wyss-Coray
ArticleOpen Access26 Feb 2025

elements.title: The conserved HIV-1 spacer peptide 2 triggers matrix lattice maturation (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
The conserved HIV-1 spacer peptide 2 triggers matrix lattice maturation

A study reports that the structural maturation of the matrix domain of the Gag protein of HIV-1 is induced by the proteolytic release and binding of the spacer peptide SP2.

  • James C. V. Stacey
  • Dominik Hrebík
  • John A. G. Briggs
ArticleOpen Access26 Feb 2025

elements.title: Continued Atlantic overturning circulation even under climate extremes (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Continued Atlantic overturning circulation even under climate extremes

Climate models suggest that the Atlantic Meridional Overturning Circulation is unlikely to collapse this century, owing to stabilization from wind-driven upwelling in the Southern Ocean.

  • J. A. Baker
  • M. J. Bell
  • R. A. Wood
ArticleOpen Access26 Feb 2025

elements.title: Comparative characterization of human accelerated regions in neurons (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Comparative characterization of human accelerated regions in neurons

The cis-regulatory functions of human accelerated regions of genomic loci and their potential contribution to human brain evolution are revealed.

  • Xiekui Cui
  • Han Yang
  • Yin Shen
Article26 Feb 2025
